title: Calories in Semen
meta_description: Discover calories in semen per average ejaculation, including protein, carbs, fat, and other nutrients for curiosity or health insights.
assumptions: Average male ejaculation volume of ~3.5 ml; composition based on typical fructose, proteins, and minerals; not intended as a dietary source.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by individual health, diet, hydration, and frequency; values are approximate and not from standard food databases. Consult professionals for health advice.

quick_answer.text: One average ejaculation of semen contains about 15 kcal, mostly from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in semen per ejaculation?
faqs.a: Approximately 15 kcal for an average 3.5 ml ejaculation.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in semen besides calories?
faqs.a: Includes ~0.5 g protein, 1.5 g carbs (mostly sugars), minimal fat, plus minerals like sodium (~150 mg).

faqs.q: Does semen have a lot of protein?
faqs.a: No, only about 0.5 g per ejaculationâ€”far less than common protein sources.
Yes, around 150 mg per ejaculation, comparable to a small salty snack.

faqs.q: How does diet affect calories in semen?
faqs.a: Higher sugar intake can increase fructose (carbs/calories); overall low caloric impact.
